Hypenotic The Jekyll Butler

Just launched: VoteONFood.ca

18 Sep 2011

I’ve been absent from this blog lately. My nose has been to the grindstone, helping Sustain Ontario launch their new initiative, VoteON Food & Farming.

It’s a rallying call to Ontarians to make sure their candidates in the upcoming October 6th provincial election get the message: Food matters to voters and we must take food policy seriously.

It’s also also a place for Sustain Ontario to share their Good Food Ideas and give you a platform to share your own good food ideas.

And VoteOn makes it easy for you to write your candidates to tell them why food matters to you.

Over the last year and a half, I’ve found myself exposed to a lot of new (to me) ideas about food. Having clients like Sustain Ontario, Fiesta Farms, Local Food Plus and OCTA doesn’t hurt.

Nor does working for someone whose passion for food is only matched by his passion for helping people doing good things in the food space tell their stories well.

Mostly what I’ve learned is the impact our food choices have on the world around us.

As VoteOn explains, food directly effects the economy, our health, the environment, our kids,  our experience of community and our farmers.

That won’t be news to many of our regular readers, but for many Ontarians, it’s food for thought.

If you’re passionate about the food you eat and share, be sure to engage your candidates on these issues this election. VoteONfood.ca is a good place to start.
